result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S Hergert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond to be applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Must report to jail by 4:00 PM, August 23, 2016. 
Court grants 6 days credit to be applied towards conditional jail sentence. Court grants work release privileges.
Consecutive to: any other sentences.

supervisions.notes: 155 days jail credit.  Court orders a time served sentence and Defendant to be released from Jail today.
All outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: State's amended

Defendant Christopher S Hergert in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor bail jumping per section 946.49(1)(a). Court grants amendment of Count 1. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 as amended and pleads guilty to Count 2. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant makes statement.

Defendant Christopher S Hergert in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Defendant Christopher S Hergert in custody.  John M. O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CM44, 15CM305, 15CM482 AND 16CF10. 
16CF10 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton to represent on this file for now. If financial status changes, Defendant is to contact public defender's office. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint. 
Attorney Sutton will contact Branch 1 or 2 to see if all of these cases can be scheduled for a plea on Monday, January 11, 2016. In the meantime, all files set for 1/14/16 at 9:00 a.m. for 30 minutes.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
